IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO CREATE THRIVING COMMUNITIES BY HELPING NONPROFITS SUCCEED. OUR WORK REVOLVES AROUND FOUR PRIMARY AREAS OF FOCUS.1. WE ARE A HUB FOR SOCIAL INNOVATION 2. WE ARE A CAPACITY ACCELERATOR FOR ORGANIZATIONS AND THEIR PEOPLE3. WE ARE GEORGIA'S LARGEST ASSOCIATION OF NONPROFITS AND ITS INDUSTRY CHAMPION. 4. WE ARE AN INFLUENTIAL CONVENOR OF CHANGEMAKERS
IRS990.MissionDesc: OUR MISSION IS TO CREATE THRIVING COMMUNITIES BY HELPING NONPROFITS SUCCEED. OUR WORK REVOLVES AROUND FOUR PRIMARY AREAS OF FOCUS.1. WE ARE A HUB FOR SOCIAL INNOVATION 2. WE ARE A CAPACITY ACCELERATOR FOR ORGANIZATIONS AND THEIR PEOPLE3. WE ARE GEORGIA'S LARGEST ASSOCIATION OF NONPROFITS AND ITS INDUSTRY CHAMPION. 4. WE ARE AN INFLUENTIAL CONVENOR OF CHANGEMAKERS
IRS990.Desc: LEARNING & DEVELOPMENT: IN 2022, GCN SERVED 4,800 PARTICIPANTS THROUGH OUR LEARNING AND DEVELOPMENT PROGRAMMING DELIVERED IN NONPROFIT UNIVERSITY, A COMPREHENSIVE EXECUTIVE EDUCATION CENTER SPECIFIC TO NONPROFIT MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP, AND ITS INTEGRATED OFFERINGS WITHIN OTHER GCN PROGRAMS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: CONSULTING: IN 2022, GCN PROVIDED INDIVIDUAL AND COHORT CONSULTING, COACHING/ADVISEMENT AND FACILITATION SERVICES TO 80 ORGANIZATIONS DIRECTLY OR VIA REFERRAL TO QUALIFIED EXPERTS. GCN'S NONPROFIT CONSULTING GROUP FOCUSES ON STRATEGY, REVENUE GENERATION, GOVERNANCE AND LEADERSHIP, CHANGE AND GROWTH INITIATIVES, AND WORKFORCE ISSUES SPECIFIC TO IMPROVING NONPROFIT EFFECTIVENESS AND SUCCESS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: INFORMATION, TOOLS & RESOURCES: IN 2022, GCN'S RESOURCES WERE ACCESSED 984,016 TIMES. GCN PROVIDES AN ARRAY OF SUPPORT SERVICES THROUGH A DIGITAL KNOWLEDGEBASE, PUBLICATIONS, INTERACTIVE TOOLS, AND CONTENT PRODUCTION RELATED TO CAPACITY TOPICS AND SECTOR RELATED TRENDS AND POLICY. IN ADDITION TO GENERAL DISTRIBUTION, THESE RESOURCES ARE MADE AVAILABLE THROUGH FOCUSED EFFORTS LIKE GAGIVES.ORG, WORK FOR GOOD, GA NONPROFIT NEWS, INFORMATIONAL EVENTS, A BOARD/STAFF HELPLINE, AND GCN.ORG THAT SUPPORT NONPROFITS MANAGEMENT CAPACITY, FUNDRAISING, AND TALENT NEEDS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: WORK FOR GOOD: GCN'S NATIONAL NONPROFIT JOB BOARD, WORKFORGOOD.ORG, IS OUR ONLINE HUB FOR NON-PROFIT EMPLOYMENT CONNECTION AND HR SUPPORT. THIS REVENUE-GENERATING SOCIAL ENTERPRISE CONTINUES TO SERVE AS AN INDISPENSABLE RESOURCE FOR NONPROFIT HR PROFESSIONALS AND ALSO ACTS AS A CAREER DEVELOPMENT CENTER BY PROVIDING A PLATFORM FOR OUTREACH, COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS RESEARCH, AND HR SUPPORT ON A NATIONAL SCALE. ADVOCACY: GCN ADVOCATES FOR THE LARGER SECTOR AT THE LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL LEVELS. THROUGH GCN'S ONGOING ADVOCACY AND EDUCATION EFFORTS, WE INFORMED MEMBERS ABOUT COMMUNITY ISSUES IMPORTANT TO THE SECTOR, AND LEGISLATIVE ACTIONS AFFECTING THE SECTOR, OUR CAUSES, AND STAKEHOLDERS. GAGIVES ON #GIVINGTUESDAY: THIS UNIQUE STATEWIDE ONLINE GIVING INITIATIVE RAISES FUNDS TO SUPPORT THOUSANDS OF GEORGIA NONPROFITS AND ENGAGE CITIZENS IN A MULTI-MEDIA AWARENESS CAMPAIGN ABOUT GA NONPROFITS. SUPPORTED BY A MULTI- SECTOR COALITION THAT SPANS THE MEDIA, CORPORATE, FOUNDATION, GOVERNMENT, AND NONPROFIT COMMUNITIES, THE PIONEERING GAGIVES.ORG PLATFORM PROVIDES A FREE YEAR-ROUND GIVING TOOL FOR ALL GEORGIA NONPROFITS, SUPPORTED BY TOOLS AND TRAINING TO HELP THEM LEVERAGE ONLINE TECHNOLOGIES AND SOCIAL MEDIA TO INCREASE FUNDRAISING CAPACITY. OUR MASS-MEDIA CAMPAIGN REACHED MILLIONS, CATALYZING AWARENESS OF THE WORK AND WORTH OF THE SECTOR WHILE INSPIRING FIRST-TIME GIVING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, THE CENTER IS EXEMPT FROM TAXES ON INCOME OTHER THAN UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. THE CENTER IS SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES ON UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME FROM ADVERTISING. AT DECEMBER 31, 2022 AND 2021, THE CENTER HAD FEDERAL INCOME TAX NET OPERATING LOSS (NOL) CARRYFORWARDS OF $37,207 AND $32,891, RESPECTIVELY. NRC IS SUBJECT TO INCOME TAXES ON PROFITS FROM OPERATIONS. AT DECEMBER 31, 2022 AND 2021, NRC HAD FEDERAL INCOME TAX NET NOL CARRYFORWARDS OF $234,107 AND $207,534, RESPECTIVELY. STATE NOL CARRYFORWARDS ARE SIMILAR TO FEDERAL AMOUNTS FOR EACH YEAR. DUE TO IMMATERIAL AMOUNTS, THE DEFERRED INCOME TAX BENEFIT OF THE LOSS CARRYFORWARD FOR THE CENTER HAS NOT BEEN RECORDED. THE DEFERRED INCOME TAX BENEFIT OF THE LOSS CARRYFORWARD FOR NRC HAS NOT BEEN RECORDED, AS THE LIKELIHOOD OF REALIZING ANY INCOME TAX BENEFIT FROM THE UTILIZATION OF THIS LOSS CARRYFORWARD HAS NOT BEEN ESTABLISHED. THE ORGANIZATIONS UTILIZE THE ACCOUNTING REQUIREMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES USING THE PROVISIONS OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD (FASB) ASC 740, INCOME TAXES. USING THAT GUIDANCE, TAX POSITIONS INITIALLY NEED TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WHEN IT IS MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT THE POSITIONS WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY THE TAX AUTHORITIES. IT ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE FOR DERECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS, DISCLOSURE AND TRANSITION. AS OF DECEMBER 31, 2022 AND 2021, THE ORGANIZATIONS HAVE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT QUALIFY FOR RECOGNITION OR DISCLOSURE IN THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

THE 2022 FORM 990 WAS FILED WITH PRELIMINARY INFORMATION AS THE AUDIT WAS STILL IN PROCESS. AN AMENDED RETURN IS NOW BEING FILED AS THERE WERE CHANGES TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. FORM 990, PART VIII, LINE 1H ORIGINALLY REFLECTED $6,000 OF NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS. THE AMENDED RETURN REFLECTS THIS AMOUNT AS $0 DUE TO THE FACT THAT THIS WAS FOR DONATED LEGAL SERVICES. THEREFORE TOTAL REVENUE HAS DECREASED $6,000 FROM THE ORIGINALLY FILED RETURN. PART IX: STATEMENT OF FUNCTIONAL EXPENSES HAS A NET INCREASE IN THE AMOUNT OF THE $784. CHANGES WERE MADE TO OTHER EXPENSES, INTEREST EXPENSE, AND DEPRECIATION EXPENSE. PART X: BALANCE SHEET SHOWS AN INCREASE IN TOTAL ASSETS OF $53,925, AN INCREASE IN TOTAL LIABILITIES OF $60,709, AND A DECREASE IN TOTAL NET ASSETS OF $6,783.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: REVIEWED IN DETAIL BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE, THEN PRESENTED AS A SUMMARY REPORT TO THE WHOLE BOARD, WITH RECOMMENDATION FROM FINANCE COMMITTEE. THE ENTIRE BOARD THEN VOTES ON ACCEPTANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DISCLOSURE WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION SHOULD BE MADE TO THE CEO (IF THE CONFLICT EXISTS WITH THE CEO, THEN DISCLOSURE SHOULD BE MADE WITH THE BOARD CHAIR) WHO SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER A CONFLICT EXISTS AND IS MATERIAL, AND, IF THE MATTER IS MATERIAL, BRING IT TO THE ATTENTION OF THE BOARD CHAIR. DISCLOSURES INVOLVING DIRECTORS SHOULD BE MADE TO THE BOARD CHAIR, WHO SHALL BRING SUCH MATTERS, IF MATERIAL, TO THE BOARD. THE BOARD SHALL DETERMINE WHETHER A CONFLICT EXISTS AND IS MATERIAL, AND IN THE PRESENCE OF AN EXISTING MATERIAL CONFLICT, WHETHER THE CONTEMPLATED TRANSACTION MAY BE AUTHORIZED AS JUST, FAIR, AND REASONABLE TO GCN. THE DECISION OF THE BOARD ON THESE MATTERS WILL REST IN THEIR SOLE DISCRETION, AND THEIR CONCERN MUST BE THE WELFARE OF GCN AND THE ADVANCEMENT OF ITS PURPOSE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TO DETERMINE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION, THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS LOOKS AT A MINIMUM OF THREE NEUTRAL BENCHMARK STUDIES FOR THE POSITIONS, SELECTS SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS IN THE REGION TO BENCHMARK, AND THEN REVIEWS THAT INFORMATION, SPEAKING WITH AN OUTSIDE COMPENSATION CONSULTANT, IF NECESSARY. TO DETERMINE COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES, BENCHMARK STUDIES AND COMPENSATION REPORTS FOR SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS ARE USED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONSULTANTS: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 220,269. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 5,395. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 84,740. TOTAL EXPENSES 310,404.
